org.jruyi.common

Class Blob

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jruyi.common.Blob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, ICloseable, IDumpable

    public final class Blob
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDumpable, ICloseable
    A Blob consists of a list of byte sequences. The content of a Blob can be looked at as a linear byte array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(IByteSequence sequence)
      Adds the whole given byte sequence sequence into this blob.
      void add(IByteSequence sequence, int offset, int length)
      Adds length bytes of the given byte sequence sequence starting at offset into this blob.
      void close()
      Recycles this instance into the local cache of the current thread.
      void dump(StringBuilder builder)
      Appends a hex dump to the given builder.
      void ensureCapacity(int minCapacity)
      Increases the capacity if necessary, to ensure that at least the number of byte arrays specified by the given minCapacity can be hold.
      static Blob get()
      Returns a Blob instance fetched from the current thread's local cache if it is not empty.
      static Blob get(int capacity)
      Returns a Blob instance fetched from the current thread's local cache if it is not empty.
      int indexOf(ByteKmp kmp)
      Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte sequence kmp.
      void insert(int index, IByteSequence sequence)
      Inserts the given sequence into this blob at the given index.
      void insert(int index, IByteSequence sequence, int offset, int length)
      Inserts length bytes of the given sequence starting at the given offset into this blob at the given index.
      int lastIndexOf(ByteKmp kmp)
      Returns the index within this sequence of the rightmost occurrence of the specified byte sequence kmp.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static Blob get()
        Returns a Blob instance fetched from the current thread's local cache if it is not empty. Otherwise, a new instance will be created and returned.
        Returns:
        an instance of Blob

      • get

        public static Blob get(int capacity)
        Returns a Blob instance fetched from the current thread's local cache if it is not empty. Otherwise, a new instance will be created and returned. The initial capacity of the returned instance is ensured to be the specified capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the initial capacity
        Returns:
        an instance of Blob

      • close

        public void close()
        Recycles this instance into the local cache of the current thread. Any further operation made to this instance is undefined.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface ICloseable

      • insert

        public void insert(int index,
                   IByteSequence sequence)
        Inserts the given sequence into this blob at the given index.

        This method behaves exactly the same as follows. 

          insert(index, sequence, 0, sequence.length())
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which the given b is to be inserted
        sequence - the byte sequence to be inserted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than size()

      • insert

        public void insert(int index,
                   IByteSequence sequence,
                   int offset,
                   int length)
        Inserts length bytes of the given sequence starting at the given offset into this blob at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which the given b is to be inserted.
        sequence - the byte sequence to be inserted
        offset - the index of the first byte to be inserted
        length - the number of bytes to be inserted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than size()
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if offset is negative, or length is negative, or (offset + length) is greater than sequence.length()

      • add

        public void add(IByteSequence sequence)
        Adds the whole given byte sequence sequence into this blob.

        This method behaves exactly the same as follows. 

          add(sequence, 0, sequence.length())
        Parameters:
        sequence - the byte sequence to be added

      • add

        public void add(IByteSequence sequence,
                int offset,
                int length)
        Adds length bytes of the given byte sequence sequence starting at offset into this blob.
        Parameters:
        sequence - the byte sequence to be added
        offset - the index of the first byte to be added
        length - the number of bytes of the given sequence to be added
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if offset is negative, or length is negative, or (offset + length) is greater than sequence.length()

      • dump

        public void dump(StringBuilder builder)
        Appends a hex dump to the given builder.
        Specified by:
        dump in interface IDumpable
        Parameters:
        builder - the StringBuilder to be appended to

      • ensureCapacity

        public void ensureCapacity(int minCapacity)
        Increases the capacity if necessary, to ensure that at least the number of byte arrays specified by the given minCapacity can be hold.
        Parameters:
        minCapacity - the desired minimum capacity

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(ByteKmp kmp)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte sequence kmp.
        Parameters:
        kmp - the byte sequence to be searched for
        Returns:
        the index of the first occurrence of the specified byte sequence kmp

      • lastIndexOf

        public int lastIndexOf(ByteKmp kmp)
        Returns the index within this sequence of the rightmost occurrence of the specified byte sequence kmp.
        Parameters:
        kmp - the byte sequence to be searched for
        Returns:
        the index of the rightmost occurrence of the specified byte sequence kmp
